messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] yahoo spammers changed your settings
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/29/02 11:08:59 AM, PSoroosh@aol.com writes:  Thank you! It sucks that they set that up
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/29/02 11:08:59 AM, PSoroosh@... writes:

<< http://edit.my.yahoo.com/config/eval_profile >>

Thank you! It sucks that they set that up without really informing you.

Paula

messages.subject: yahoo spammers changed your settings
messages.msgSnippet: Yahoo has recently reset all yahoo profiles so that you may be receiving a lot more spam -- not just email, but phone and snail-mail, too. You ll have to go in
messages.messageBody:
Yahoo has recently reset all yahoo profiles so that you may be receiving a
lot more spam -- not just email, but phone and snail-mail, too.

You'll have to go in and reset your "marketing preferences" to stop the flood
of spam.

Here is how to do it.

Go to: http://edit.my.yahoo.com/config/eval_profile
and put in your yahoo id and password.

Go down into the middle of the page and click on "Edit my marketing
preferences."

Go down that page and turn everything from "yes" to "no" -- be sure to go all
the way to the bottom - there are more questions about phone contacts and
junk mail down there.

Be sure to click on "save changes" - don't just close the page - when you're
done.

--pamS
